heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest lightning strike recorded happened on 13 May 2025 and was just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: Currently no stormy weather.  The most recent storm happened on 16 September 2025 and it lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (207°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.8°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 198 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1295 m) and feels like temperature (down 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 198.2m lower than yesterday, 705.7m lower than the past week, 1295.1m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 689m and a high of 1098m, averaging 671.0m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dark. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
